aas:langStringTextType.aas:text: This aspect represents the latest quantities of a partner's items that are on stock. The stock represent the build-to-order (BTO) stocks already available.

In case of a supplier's stocks for a customer, these stocks may reference the order position for that they have been produced. In case of a customer's stock delivered by a supplier, there is exactly one position.
In case there is no item on stock, positions MUST be empty.

The Position can be located at several stocks. In case of a supplier's stock for a customer, a position may be either anonymous or reference a position within a customer order. In case of a customer's stock for a supplier, the order position reference MUST NOT be set.
Encapsulates the references to identify a position within an order.
Stocks that have been already allocated to the customer or delivered by a specific supplier. An allocated stock always refers to a stock location.

This is the quantity of items on stock at a location. A stock can either be - from a certain supplier and ready to be consumed by a customer or - from a supplier and ready to be shipped to a certain customer.
In case of stocks "from a supplier ready to be shipped to a certain customer", the stock may refer to an order position of a customer. This stock consists only of the good-finished items.
Entity for common measurements of an item (mass, count, linear, area, volume, misc) with an unit and a value.

aas:langStringNameType.aas:text: Material Number UUID of the Customer's Twin

aas:langStringTextType.aas:text: This aspect represents the latest quantities of a partner's items that are on stock. The stock represent the build-to-order (BTO) stocks already available.

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text: This aspect represents the latest quantities of a partner's items that are on stock. The stock represent the build-to-order (BTO) stocks already available.
This is the order number on the supplier side that is given by e.g., the supplier's enterprise resource planning system.
This is the order number on the customer side that can be given by e.g., the customer's enterprise resource planning system.

This is an identifier for the position of an order defined by the customer. It's not a technical identifier, such as an UUID. This identifier is used within the business context when talking about the position.
The order position reference contains information to identify a position within an order.
Date and time at which the position has been updated by the supplier's systems. Date and time are set according to a timezone.
The quantity value associated with the unit.
The unit of an item. Common units may be related to mass, count, linear, area, volume or misc.
This is the quantity of the material on stock. In case of stocks "from a supplier ready to be shipped to a certain customer", the stock may refer to an order position of a customer.
BPNS identifying the site the stock is located at. One stock has always one location.

A set of finished items that are located on the blocked stock area, quarantine area, etc. waiting to be released.
Example: Stock is in review and not released due to customer complaint regarding a recent batch.
BPNA identifying the address the stock is located at. One stock has always one location.
Stocks that have been already allocated to the customer or delivered by a specific supplier. An allocated stock always refers to a stock location.

In case of a supplier's stocks for a customer, these stocks may reference the order position for that they have been produced. In case of a customer's stock delivered by a supplier, there is exactly one position.
In case there is no item on stock, positions MUST be empty.

Material identifier as assigned by customer. This material number identifies the material (as planned) in customer's database. For standard parts (e.g. screws) for which a customer does not have an own number, the materialNumberSupplier should be set in this field, too.

aas:langStringNameType.aas:text: Material Number UUID of the Customer's Twin

aas:langStringPreferredNameTypeIec61360.aas:text: Material Number UUID of the Customer's Twin

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text: Material identifier used uniquely to identify the Material (e.g. PartAsPlanned).
Material identifier as assigned by supplier. This material number identifies the material (as planned) in supplier's database.
Direction of the stock from data provider perspective.
